snippet: The peacekeepers, all from Fiji, were released from captivity in good condition after being held by a Syrian affiliate of Al Qaeda for nearly two weeks, the United Nations said.
abstract: Al-Qaeda backed Nusra Front releases 45 United Nations peacekeepers from Fiji who they had held captive for two weeks in Syria.

byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from the United Nations, and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: The peacekeepers, all from Fiji, were released from captivity in good condition after being held by a Syrian affiliate of Al Qaeda for nearly two weeks, the United Nations said.

headline.main: Qaeda Group Has Released 45 Members of U.N. Force
headline.print_headline: Qaeda Group Has Released 45 Members of U.N. Force
